analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge hr'i: dmar po cig bsam mo //

translated: From the hriḥ at your heart, offering goddesses carrying incense,

analyzed: aom badzra nee bi dye a'a: h'um sv'a h'a /

analyzed: de nas 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste / gang yang bdag gis dus kun du //

translated: I confess them all, as if they were

original: thams cad byang chub mchog tu bsngo //

original: de thob lam la gnas bgyid cing //
analyzed: de thob lam la gnas bgyid cing //
translated: I will abide on the path to attaining that,

original: dam pa'i skyabs gsum la skyabs mchi //
analyzed: dam pa'i skyabs gsum la skyabs mchi //

original: de nas byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / tshangs pa'i gnas rnams rim gyis bsgom /
analyzed: de nas byams pa dang / snying rje dang / dga' ba dang / btang snyoms dang / tshangs pa'i gnas rnams rim gyis bsgom /

analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma konyaham /

analyzed: zhes lan gsum brjod la ting nge 'dzin gyis chos thams cad nam mkha' lta bur stong par bsam /
translated: Recite that three times and imagine that all phenomena are empty like space through samādhi.

analyzed: de nas nam mkha'i dkyil du ram ser po las 'od 'phros pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor cig bsam /

analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du h'um mthing ga las 'od 'phros pa las rdo rje rtse lnga pa cig bsam /

analyzed: rdo rje rtse lnga pa de las 'od phyogs bcur 'phros pas rdo rje'i ra ba dang dra ba sa gzhi gur du bsam /
translated: Light radiates from that five-tined vajra in the ten directions, becoming a vajra fence, a vajra tent, and a vajra ground.

analyzed: rdo rje'i sa gzhi'i dbus su nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du yi ge bhr'um dkar po cig bsam /
translated: In the center of the vajra ground, on top of a sun maṇḍala, visualize a white bhrūṃ syllable.

original: de las 'od 'phros pas shar phyogs dngul las grub pa /
analyzed: de las 'od 'phros pas shar phyogs dngul las grub pa /
translated: Light radiates from that and the east is made of silver.

original: lho bee d'urya las grub pa /🔽nub shel dmar po las grub pa /

original: byang gser las grub pa /
analyzed: byang gser las grub pa /

original: sgo bzhi yod pa /

analyzed: yang na thod pa'i gzhal yas khang stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi rgya khyon tsam /

original: steng zhing chen gyi g-yang gzhis bkab pa /
analyzed: steng zhing chen gyi g-yang gzhis bkab pa /
translated: It is covered above with a canopy of human skin.

original: sgo bzhi yod pa /
analyzed: sgo bzhi yod pa /

analyzed: nang nas bltas na phyi gsal ba'i gzhal yas khang cig tu bsgom mo //

original: sgrub pa po rang gi sems yi ge ram cig tu bsgom /
analyzed: sgrub pa po rang gi sems yi ge ram cig tu bsgom /

analyzed: ram ser po de las 'od 'phros shing 'dus pa las nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor cig bsgom /

analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rang hr'i: dmar po cig tu bsgom /

original: spyan gsum pa /

analyzed: aa zhes pas rna ba g-yon pa nas don yod grub pas bdud rtsi'i dbang bskur bar bsam mo //
translated: By A, one should imagine that Amoghasiddhi confers the initiation of nectar upon the left ear.

original: snying ga'i rdo rje rgya gram las 'od zer lcags kyu lta bu 'phros pas de nas grub pa'i dpal rta mgrin nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa cig spyan drangs la /
analyzed: snying ga'i rdo rje rgya gram las 'od zer lcags kyu lta bu 'phros pas de nas grub pa'i dpal rta mgrin nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa cig spyan drangs la /
translated: Light rays in the form of hooks radiate from the heart’s vajra cross, and one should invite the glorious Siddhaikavīra Hayagrīva, who is seated upon a sun mandala.

original: rgya gram ljang gu las 'od 'phros pas mchod pa'i lha mo lnga byung bas snga ma bzhin du mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgya gram ljang gu las 'od 'phros pas mchod pa'i lha mo lnga byung bas snga ma bzhin du mchod par bya'o //
translated: Green light rays radiate from the vajra cross, and the five offering goddesses arise and make offerings as before.

original: rgya gram gyi chang ba la dza: h'um bam ho: bsams la dza: las 'od zer lcags kyu lta bus dpal rta mgrin spyan drangs la /
analyzed: rgya gram gyi chang ba la dza: h'um bam ho: bsams la dza: las 'od zer lcags kyu lta bus dpal rta mgrin spyan drangs la /
translated: One should imagine a J, HŪM, VAM, and HOḥ in the prongs of the vajra cross, and by the J, light rays in the form of hooks invite the glorious Hayagrīva.

original: h'um las 'od 'phros pas ye shes sems dpa' la phog pas bdag la zhugs /
analyzed: h'um las 'od 'phros pas ye shes sems dpa' la phog pas bdag la zhugs /
translated: Light shines from the HŪṂ, strikes the gnosis being, and enters me.

original: bam las 'od 'phros pas bcings /
analyzed: bam las 'od 'phros pas bcings /
translated: Light shines from the BAṂ, and it is bound.

original: ho: las 'od 'phros pas ye shes sems dpa' dgyes pa'i tshul du bzhugs par bsam /
analyzed: ho: las 'od 'phros pas ye shes sems dpa' dgyes pa'i tshul du bzhugs par bsam /
translated: Light shines from the HOḤ, and the gnosis being is thought to remain in a delighted way.

original: sku la gtad la bsgom pas dub na sa bon gyi yi ge la gtad la sngags 'di bzlas so //
analyzed: sku la gtad la bsgom pas dub na sa bon gyi yi ge la gtad la sngags 'di bzlas so //
translated: When one is tired of meditating while focusing on the body, focus on the seed syllable and recite this mantra:

original: aom badzra kro dha ha ya @111b gr'i ba hu lu hu lu h'um phat ces ci mang du bzlas so //
analyzed: aom badzra kro dha ha ya @111b gr'i ba hu lu hu lu h'um phat ces ci mang du bzlas so //
translated: OṂ VAJRA KRODHAYA HAYAGRĪVA BHU LU BHU LU HŪṂ Phat.

original: sa bon gyi yi ge las 'od 'phros pas nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad la 'phags pa rta mgrin du gyur par bsam /
analyzed: sa bon gyi yi ge las 'od 'phros pas nam mkha'i mthas gtugs pa thams cad la 'phags pa rta mgrin du gyur par bsam /
translated: Light shines from the seed syllable, and one imagines that all the way to the ends of space it becomes Ārya Hayagrīva.

original: bzlas pas dub na ye shes pa mdun du bton la lha mo lngas snga ma bzhin du mchod do //
analyzed: bzlas pas dub na ye shes pa mdun du bton la lha mo lngas snga ma bzhin du mchod do //
translated: When one is tired of reciting, one should bring the gnosis being in front and make offerings with the five goddesses as before.

original: tshe 'di nyid la dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir yi ge brgya pa bzlas /
analyzed: tshe 'di nyid la dngos grub thob par bya ba'i phyir yi ge brgya pa bzlas /
translated: In order to attain power in this very life, one should recite the hundred-syllable mantra.

original: 'phags pa rta mgrin la bstod pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa rta mgrin la bstod pa /
translated: Praise of Ārya Hayagrīva

original: h'um sku mdog chags med nub kha'i dmar thag 'dra //
analyzed: h'um sku mdog chags med nub kha'i dmar thag 'dra //
translated: Hum. His body is like the glow of the setting sun.

original: 'bar ba'i dbul ral ba gyen du brdzes //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i dbul ral ba gyen du brdzes //
translated: His blazing hair stands on end.

original: ma rig tshangs pa kha sbub gnon pa'i lha //
analyzed: ma rig tshangs pa kha sbub gnon pa'i lha //
translated: He tramples on the supine Brahma of ignorance.

original: padma rig sngags rgyal la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: padma rig sngags rgyal la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the lotus, the king of mantras.

original: ye shes ha ya gri ba rta mchog dpal //
analyzed: ye shes ha ya gri ba rta mchog dpal //
translated: The wisdom Hayagriva, glorious supreme horse,

original: zhal nas 'brug stong di ri ri //
analyzed: zhal nas 'brug stong di ri ri //
translated: From his mouth a thousand thunderclaps roar.🔽When he bares his fangs,

original: tshems gtsigs tsam na tshems nang nas //
analyzed: tshems gtsigs tsam na tshems nang nas //
translated: From within his teeth,

original: gdug pa'i me stag kham kham 'bar //
analyzed: gdug pa'i me stag kham kham 'bar //
translated: Fierce sparks of fire flare up.

original: khro rgyal dbang gi rta skad tser tser mtsher //
analyzed: khro rgyal dbang gi rta skad tser tser mtsher //
translated: The wrathful king neighs with the sound of thunder.

original: zhes bstod / mkhyen par gshegs par bya ba'i phyir dza: dza: zhes lan gsum brjod do //
analyzed: zhes bstod / mkhyen par gshegs par bya ba'i phyir dza: dza: zhes lan gsum brjod do //
translated: In order to make him aware, say “Jham jham” three times.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'di ltar bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa 'di ltar bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The completion stage is to meditate as follows:

original: bdag nyid rta mgrin du bsgoms pa'i snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: bdag nyid rta mgrin du bsgoms pa'i snying gar nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: Meditate on yourself as Hayagriva. In your heart is a sun mandala.

original: de'i steng du yi ge hr'i: dmar po las phyogs bcur 'od 'phros te /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge hr'i: dmar po las phyogs bcur 'od 'phros te /
translated: Upon that is a red syllable Hrih, from which light radiates to the ten directions.

original: phyi snod kyi 'jig rten dang nang bcud kyi 'jig rten la phog pas 'od du zhu nas kun rta mgrin gyi ngo bor bsam /
analyzed: phyi snod kyi 'jig rten dang nang bcud kyi 'jig rten la phog pas 'od du zhu nas kun rta mgrin gyi ngo bor bsam /
translated: Since it strikes the outer world and the inner world of beings, they melt into light and are imagined to be in essence Hayagrīva.

original: 'od de dag thams cad rang gi lus la bsdu /🔽dam tshig sems dpa' ye shes sems dpa'i rta mgrin dmar po la bsdu /
analyzed: 'od de dag thams cad rang gi lus la bsdu / dam tshig sems dpa' ye shes sems dpa'i rta mgrin dmar po la bsdu /
translated: All those lights are gathered into one’s body.🔽The pledge being and the awareness being Hayagrīva are gathered into the red hūṃ.

original: hr'i: dmar po thig le dkar zhing 'tsher ba yungs kar tsam cig la bsdu /
analyzed: hr'i: dmar po thig le dkar zhing 'tsher ba yungs kar tsam cig la bsdu /
translated: The red hūṃ is gathered into a white, shining bindu the size of a mustard seed.

original: yungs kar tsam po de yang mi dmigs par bsgom ste gsal la mi rtog pa cig tu bsgom mo //🔽lha'i bu'i bdud 'dul bar 'dod na /
analyzed: yungs kar tsam po de yang mi dmigs par bsgom ste gsal la mi rtog pa cig tu bsgom mo // lha'i bu'i bdud 'dul bar 'dod na /
translated: That mustard-seed-sized bindu is also meditated on as being unobservable, meditating on clarity without discursive thought.

original: rdo rje rtse lnga pa thogs pa'i phyag la mchod pa bya /
analyzed: rdo rje rtse lnga pa thogs pa'i phyag la mchod pa bya /
translated: If one wishes to subdue the māra of the deva sons, make offerings to the hand holding the five-pronged vajra.

original: lha klu mthu bo che thams cad dbang du sdud par 'dod na dung chen thogs pa'i phyag la mchod pa bya /
analyzed: lha klu mthu bo che thams cad dbang du sdud par 'dod na dung chen thogs pa'i phyag la mchod pa bya /
translated: If one wishes to bring all powerful devas and nāgas under control, make offerings to the hand holding the great conch.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal zhi bar 'dod na zhags pa thogs pa'i phyag la mchod pa bya /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal zhi bar 'dod na zhags pa thogs pa'i phyag la mchod pa bya /
translated: If one wishes to pacify one’s own and others’ suffering, make offerings to the hand holding the lasso.

original: byis pa'i gdon bco brgyad dang / bgegs rigs stong phrag brgyad cu dang / lha 'dre ma rungs pa thams cad 'dul bar 'dod na ral gri thogs pa'i phyag la mchod pa bya /
analyzed: byis pa'i gdon bco brgyad dang / bgegs rigs stong phrag brgyad cu dang / lha 'dre ma rungs pa thams cad 'dul bar 'dod na ral gri thogs pa'i phyag la mchod pa bya /
translated: If one wishes to subdue the eighteen types of child-demons, the eighty thousand types of obstructors, and all the vicious gods and demons, one should make offerings to the hand holding a sword.

original: lha 'dre mthu bo che thams cad bran bzhin du 'khol bar 'dod na /
analyzed: lha 'dre mthu bo che thams cad bran bzhin du 'khol bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to have all the powerful gods and demons serve one like servants,

original: seng ldeng gi rta thogs pa'i phyag la mchod pa bya /
analyzed: seng ldeng gi rta thogs pa'i phyag la mchod pa bya /
translated: one should make offerings to the hand holding a horse made of acacia wood.

original: klu ma rungs pa thams cad gdul bar 'dod na /🔽bya khyung thogs pa'i phyag @112a * //
analyzed: klu ma rungs pa thams cad gdul bar 'dod na / bya khyung thogs pa'i phyag @112a * //
translated: If one wishes to subdue all the vicious nāgas,

original: la mchod pa bya /
analyzed: la mchod pa bya /
translated: one should make offerings to the hand holding a garuḍa.

original: chu grong khyer ram yul du byung ba bzlog par 'dod na /
analyzed: chu grong khyer ram yul du byung ba bzlog par 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to avert the occurrence of a water-town or a water-country,

original: seng ldeng gi phur bu sor brgyad pa la rta mgrin gyi sngags sngon du 'bum bsnyen pa byas la las kyi dus su yang 'bum byas te btab na chu'i rgyun bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: seng ldeng gi phur bu sor brgyad pa la rta mgrin gyi sngags sngon du 'bum bsnyen pa byas la las kyi dus su yang 'bum byas te btab na chu'i rgyun bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: one should perform one hundred thousand repetitions of the mantra of Hayagrīva in front of an eight-finger-width kīla of acacia wood. At the time of the ritual action, one should perform one hundred thousand repetitions again. If one strikes with it, the flow of water will be averted.

original: shva bzlog par 'dod na brangs dang lcags la 'brug gi gzugs bris la seng ldeng gi phur bu sor brgyad pa cig la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad btab la shva sar btab na bzlog par 'gyur ro //🔽ser ba bsrung bar 'dod na yungs kar la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad btab la yungs kar la cha'i nang du dril la phyogs bzhi mtshams brgyad dkyil dang dgu ru sba /
analyzed: shva bzlog par 'dod na brangs dang lcags la 'brug gi gzugs bris la seng ldeng gi phur bu sor brgyad pa cig la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad btab la shva sar btab na bzlog par 'gyur ro // ser ba bsrung bar 'dod na yungs kar la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad btab la yungs kar la cha'i nang du dril la phyogs bzhi mtshams brgyad dkyil dang dgu ru sba /
translated: If one wishes to avert hail, one should draw a dragon on copper or iron, and one should bury an eight-finger-width acacia stake on which one has incanted one hundred and eight times, in the direction of the hail.🔽If one wishes to protect against hail, one should incanted one hundred and eight times some white mustard seeds, wrap them in a cloth, and bury them in the four directions, the eight intermediate directions, and the center.

original: gdong zlog la bye ma la sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la 'brug dang / sprin dang / glog rgod pa'i sar btab na ser ba bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gdong zlog la bye ma la sngags lan brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas la 'brug dang / sprin dang / glog rgod pa'i sar btab na ser ba bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wishes to avert hail, one should incanted one hundred and eight times some sand, and bury it in the place where the thunder, clouds, and lightning are raging.

original: 'bras dang gag pa dang / lhog pa kun la 'jim ba la sngags btab ste byugs na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras dang gag pa dang / lhog pa kun la 'jim ba la sngags btab ste byugs na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For all diseases of rice, barley, and smallpox, one should anoint with clay incanted with the mantra.

original: mi nad dang / phyugs nad dang / yams gyi nad la seng ldeng gi phur bu sor bzhi ba la sngags stong phrag bdun bzlas la phyogs bzhir bcugs la snga dro'i dus su chu gtsang ma la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te /
analyzed: mi nad dang / phyugs nad dang / yams gyi nad la seng ldeng gi phur bu sor bzhi ba la sngags stong phrag bdun bzlas la phyogs bzhir bcugs la snga dro'i dus su chu gtsang ma la sngags brgya rtsa brgyad bzlas te /
translated: For human illness, cattle disease, and contagious disease, enchant a four-finger-width peg of neem wood seven thousand times and drive it into the four directions.

original: khang thog nas gtor na yams nad thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khang thog nas gtor na yams nad thams cad zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the morning, enchant pure water one hundred and eight times and sprinkle it on the roof of the house.🔽If you wish to give a torma, meditate on yourself as glorious Hayagriva, and at the heart a red hri.

original: gtor ma gtong par 'dod pas bdag nyid dpal rta mgrin du bsgoms la snying gar hr'i: dmar po las 'od phyogs bcur 'phros pas sems can thams cad rta mgrin du bsgoms la /
analyzed: gtor ma gtong par 'dod pas bdag nyid dpal rta mgrin du bsgoms la snying gar hr'i: dmar po las 'od phyogs bcur 'phros pas sems can thams cad rta mgrin du bsgoms la /
translated: Light radiates out into the ten directions, and all sentient beings meditate on themselves as Hayagriva.🔽Again, light radiates out from the heart of Hayagriva into the ten directions, and they all become Hayagriva.

original: yang rta mgrin gyi thugs ka nas 'od zer phyogs bcur 'phros pas rta mgrin du gyur pa de gtor ma'i steng du spyan drangs te /
analyzed: yang rta mgrin gyi thugs ka nas 'od zer phyogs bcur 'phros pas rta mgrin du gyur pa de gtor ma'i steng du spyan drangs te /
translated: Invite them to the top of the torma.

original: gtor ma'i steng du bam dmar po cig bsam /
analyzed: gtor ma'i steng du bam dmar po cig bsam /
translated: On the top of the torma, imagine a red bam.

original: bam de la sa 'od 'phros te /
analyzed: bam de la sa 'od 'phros te /
translated: Light radiates out from that bam.

original: slar bam la thim pas shel dmar po las grub pa'i rin po che'i snod yangs shing rgya che ba cig bsam /
analyzed: slar bam la thim pas shel dmar po las grub pa'i rin po che'i snod yangs shing rgya che ba cig bsam /
translated: It dissolves back into the skull, and you imagine that the skull becomes a vast and wide jeweled vessel made of red crystal.

original: rang rta mgrin du bsgoms pa'i snying ga'i hr'i: dmar po de'i 'od nam mkha' la 'phros pas /🔽hr'i: dkar dmar ser sngo /
analyzed: rang rta mgrin du bsgoms pa'i snying ga'i hr'i: dmar po de'i 'od nam mkha' la 'phros pas / hr'i: dkar dmar ser sngo /
translated: Light radiates from the red hri at your heart as Hayagriva and strikes the sky.

original: gnag 'od byung pas bdud rtsi'i chu rgyun babs pas gang bar bsam /
analyzed: gnag 'od byung pas bdud rtsi'i chu rgyun babs pas gang bar bsam /
translated: White, red, yellow, green, blue, and black hri emanate and return, and you imagine that the skull is filled with a stream of elixir.

original: de nas gtor ma rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir sarba ka ri zhes lan bdun brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gtor ma rnam par dag par bya ba'i phyir sarba ka ri zhes lan bdun brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, in order to purify the torma, you should recite “sarva-kar-ri” seven times.

original: gtor ma nyid bdud rtsir byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtor ma nyid bdud rtsir byin gyis brlab pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to bless the torma itself as elixir,

original: na ma: sarba ta th'a ga ta aa pa lo ki te /
analyzed: na ma: sarba ta th'a ga ta aa pa lo ki te /
translated: recite “namaḥ sarva-tathāgata-aptobhāva”

original: aom sam bha ra sam bha ra h'um zhes nyi shu rtsa gcig brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: aom sam bha ra sam bha ra h'um zhes nyi shu rtsa gcig brjod par bya ste /
translated: and “oṃ sambhara sambhara hūṃ” twenty-one times.

original: yang na sngags bdun tshan bzhi @112b brjod la chu la gdab bo //
analyzed: yang na sngags bdun tshan bzhi @112b brjod la chu la gdab bo //
translated: Alternatively, recite the four sets of seven mantras and sprinkle water.

original: ye shes kyi chos skyong la nyi shu rtsa gcig brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi chos skyong la nyi shu rtsa gcig brjod par bya'o //
translated: Recite twenty-one times for the awareness Dharma protectors.

original: phyogs skyong 'jig rten pa la yang sngags bdun tshan bzhi brjod do //
analyzed: phyogs skyong 'jig rten pa la yang sngags bdun tshan bzhi brjod do //
translated: Also, for the worldly guardians, one should recite the four sets of seven mantras.

original: yang na aom a'a: h'um hr'i: zhes nyi shu rtsa gcig brjod bar bya'o //🔽'phags pa rta mgrin gyi sgrub thabs zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yang na aom a'a: h'um hr'i: zhes nyi shu rtsa gcig brjod bar bya'o // 'phags pa rta mgrin gyi sgrub thabs zhes bya ba /
translated: Or else, one should recite twenty-one times: Oṃ āḥ hūṃ hriḥ.🔽The Sadhana of Noble Hayagrīva

original: slob dpon dpal mar me mdzad ye shes kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so//
analyzed: slob dpon dpal mar me mdzad ye shes kyis mdzad pa rdzogs so//
translated: The composition of the master Śrī Dīpaṃkaraśrījñāna is complete.
